channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Where is the threat from Russia and China in the arctic?
item.description: As Trump points to Russia and China near Greenland, experts say the biggest Russian and Chinese activity is elsewhere in the Arctic.
item.content:encoded: As Trump points to Russia and China near Greenland, experts say the biggest Russian and Chinese activity is elsewhere in the Arctic.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: U.S. rock climber Alex Honnold reaches top of Taipei 101 skyscraper without ropes
item.description: Cheers erupted from a street-level crowd as Alex Honnold reached the top of the spire of the 508-meter (1,667-foot) tower, about 90 minutes after he started.
item.content:encoded:
Cheers erupted from a street-level crowd as Alex Honnold reached the top of the spire of the 508-meter (1,667-foot) tower, about 90 minutes after he started.

(Image credit: Chiang Ying-ying)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Russian strikes knock out heat in freezing Kyiv as peace talks continue
item.description: Russian strikes left much of Kyiv without heat, water and power during freezing temperature, even as Ukraine, Russia and the U.S. held talks on ending the nearly four-year war.
item.content:encoded:
Russian strikes left much of Kyiv without heat, water and power during freezing temperature, even as Ukraine, Russia and the U.S. held talks on ending the nearly four-year war.

(Image credit: Danylo Antoniuk)
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: Greenland, tariffs and NATO: a rollercoaster week in transatlantic relations
item.description: After President Trump's upheaval at Davos, U.S. allies are openly questioning whether Washington can still anchor the rules-based order.
item.content:encoded: After President Trump's upheaval at Davos, U.S. allies are openly questioning whether Washington can still anchor the rules-based order.
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: Trump threatens Canada with 100% tariffs over its new trade deal with China
item.description: The announcement is a reversal for Trump, who initially initially praised the agreement with China as something Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney "should be doing."
item.content:encoded:
The announcement is a reversal for Trump, who initially initially praised the agreement with China as something Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney "should be doing."

(Image credit: Jacques Boissinot)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Heavy snow and rainfall kill 61, injure 110 over 3 days in Afghanistan
item.description: Dozens were killed and hundreds homes destroyed, according to the country's disaster management authority, in storms impacting 15 of Afghanistan's 34 provinces.
item.content:encoded:
Dozens were killed and hundreds homes destroyed, according to the country's disaster management authority, in storms impacting 15 of Afghanistan's 34 provinces.

(Image credit: Mohammad Amin)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: China's top general under investigation in latest military purge
item.description: Analysts believe these purges aim to reform the military and ensure loyalty to Chinese leader Xi Jinping. Another commission member, Liu Zhenli, is also under investigation.
item.content:encoded:
Analysts believe these purges aim to reform the military and ensure loyalty to Chinese leader Xi Jinping. Another commission member, Liu Zhenli, is also under investigation.

(Image credit: Ng Han Guan/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Danish community reacts to Trump's rhetoric around Greenland
item.description: Danish citizens say President Trump's latest push to control Greenland is changing their view on Denmark's relationship with America.
item.content:encoded: Danish citizens say President Trump's latest push to control Greenland is changing their view on Denmark's relationship with America.
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: UNESCO has officially added yodeling to its list of 'Intangible Cultural Heritage'
item.description: Yodeling has been officially recognized by the UN as part of the world's intangible cultural heritage.
item.content:encoded: Yodeling has been officially recognized by the UN as part of the world's intangible cultural heritage.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: At Davos, U.S. allies question a fraying world order
item.description: It was a volatile week for trans-Atlantic relations, marked by President Trump statements that unsettled global markets and strained ties with U.S. allies — on topics ranging from Greenland to Gaza.
item.content:encoded:
It was a volatile week for trans-Atlantic relations, marked by President Trump statements that unsettled global markets and strained ties with U.S. allies — on topics ranging from Greenland to Gaza.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx
